info.title: API
info.description:
API to manage your %product% resources programmatically. Using these APIs, you are able to manage pages, integrate with CI/CD, and retrieve resources among other operations.

All operations require an API key, read [Authentication](/api#authentication).

All operations (except [Search content](/api#search)) must be called from a back-end. Cross-origin requests are not allowed.

get.description: Reads a reference definition. Permission: `reference.read`. Rate limit: 600 in 60 seconds.

slug.description: Slug in the URL. Generated if it was not provided

content.description: Draft contents of the page in [Darkdown format](https://docs.developerhub.io/support-center/exporting-documentation#darkdown)
content.example:
Let's start here

## Step 1
Welcome to **DeveloperHub**

categoryTitle.description: To append the page to a category, provide the pre-existing category title here (case insensitive)

post.description: Creates a page with draft contents. To insert in a pre-existing category, set the `categoryTitle`. Rate limit: 10800 in 1 hour. Permission: `page.edit`

put.description: Publishes a page from its draft contents. Rate limit: 10800 in 1 hour. Permission: `page.publish`

get.description: Lists all project versions that are accessible through the API Key. This will only list non-deleted versions. Rate limit: 60 in 60 minutes. Permission: `project.read`

published.description: True if it can be viewed by readers

put.description: Updates a version. Enables you to publish or unpublish a version. Rate limit: 3600 in 1 hour. Permission: `version.publish`

get.summary: Lists all documentation section under version
get.description: Lists all documentation sections under the version. This will only list non-deleted documentation sections. Rate limit: 60 in 60 minutes. Permission: `project.read`

put.description: Publishes the draft of an API reference. Rate limit: 3600 in 1 hour. Permission: `reference.publish`

get.description: Get all users and their roles. Rate limit: 3600 in 60 minutes. Permission: `project.read`

get.summary: Get access details of all invited readers
get.description: Get access details of all invited readers. Rate limit: 3600 in 60 minutes. Permission: `access.read`

expiresAt.description: Date of expiry in Y-m-d\TH:i:sP format

post.description: Grants access to reader. Only applicable when project is protected by "Email Invite". Rate limit: 100 in 60 minutes. Permission: `access.write`

patch.description: Revokes access to reader. Rate limit: 100 in 60 minutes. Permission: `access.write`

get.description:
Get a page by slugs and read its content in [Darkdown](https://docs.developerhub.io/support-center/exporting-documentation#darkdown), markdown, HTML, or text format. Rate limit: 60 in 1 minute.

Either `version_id` or `version_slug` must be provided. Either `documentation_id` or `documentation_slug` must be provided. Permission: `page.read`

Read a page including its content in [Darkdown](https://docs.developerhub.io/support-center/exporting-documentation#darkdown), markdown, HTML, or text format. Rate limit: 600 in 1 minute. Permission: `page.read`

slug.description: Slug in the URL. Generated if it was not provided

content.description: Draft contents of the page in [Darkdown format](https://docs.developerhub.io/support-center/exporting-documentation#darkdown)
content.example:
Let's start here

## Step 1
Welcome to **DeveloperHub**

put.description: Updates a page title, slug or draft contents. Rate limit: 10800 in 1 hour. Permission: `page.edit`

parameters.name: version_slug
parameters.description: Slug of the version to be searched. To use always the default published version, use 'latest'. Omit to search in the entire project

parameters.name: section_slug
parameters.description: Slug of the section to be searched. Omit to search in the entire version. If `version_slug` is not set, the default published version would be used.

parameters.name: section_type
parameters.description: Type of the section. `doc` for documentation or `ref` for reference. Must be specified when `section_slug` is set.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Specify the page to retrieve. Numbering starts from 0.

query.description: Searches through project or version. Use this to build custom search into your own website/services which directs users to documentation. Minimum plan required is Grow plan. Rate limit: 10,800 in 60 minutes. This endpoint can also be called using `get` method. Permission: `search`

parameters.name: published
parameters.description: When true, only lists published items.

parameters.name: versionId
parameters.description: The version to get all resources from. Use `latest` to automatically choose the default version.

get.description: Returns all pages, documentation, references and versions of your project. Rate limit: 30 in 60 minutes. Permission: `project.read`

parameters.name: max_date
parameters.description: Maximum date to retrieve audits in Y-m-d\TH:i:sP format. Note that "+" character must be encoded to "%2B"

parameters.name: hits
parameters.description: Number of hits to retrieve. Maximum is 100

parameters.name: cursor
parameters.description: Cursor for next page of results

get.description: Query the audit log. Only available in enterprise plans. Rate limit: 600 in 60 minutes. Permission: `audit.read`

file.description: The API specification in OpenAPI 2/3 (Swagger) format

parameters.name: publish
parameters.description: By default true, set to false to write a draft instead. Permission needed would be `reference.edit`.

post.summary: Adds or updates an API reference
post.description: Adds or updates an API reference in that version. If the reference title matches one that already existed, then it is updated. Changes are published and do not pass through a draft state. Rate limit: 300 in 60 minutes. Permission: `reference.publish`

parameters.name: version_slug
parameters.description: Provide version slug if you wish to export a specific version only

get.description: Exports the project into a ZIP file. Only available for enterprise plans. Rate limit: 10 in 60 minutes. Permission: `project.export`

listed.description: True if it can be viewed by readers if the version is published

contentDraft.description: Draft content in the selected format

contentPublished.description: Published content in the selected format

path.description: Path of the page without the project basepath (if any)

lastActiveAt.description: Date of last time user accessed DeveloperHub

published.description: True if it can be viewed by readers
True if it can be viewed by readers

content.example:
To use project variables in an API Reference, replace all occurrences of the variable with the variable reference. For example, one definition property could be:
version:
    type: string
    description: Version of the API
    example: "%versions.last_version%"


Warning
Note that YAML requires you to use double quotations to escape a string containing percent sign.
Known Limitations

Variables do not work as HREFs for links.

title.description: Title of the hit. It is either the page title or the heading title for the hit if it is in a documentation page, or the name of the operation if it was in an API reference.

sectionType.description: Type of section: 'doc' for documentation or 'ref' for reference

path.description: Path, without the host, to direct the user to to find the content

nbPages.description: Number of pages that can be searched for this query

basepath.description: Basepath of the project, if any.

host.description: Host of the project including scheme.

ipAddress.description: IP Address of the user who made the change

apiKey.description: True if change was authenticated through an API Key

cursor.description: Cursor for next page of results. Null value if there are no more results

expiresAt.description: Date when the access expires. Null if it never expires.

revoked.description: Date when revoked. Null if not revoked.

page.description: A key-value dictionary mapping of page ID to page details

listed.description: True if page is accessible for readers

documentation.description: A key-value dictionary mapping of documentation ID to documentation details

slug.description: Slug of the documentation in the URL

reference.description: A key-value dictionary mapping of reference ID to reference details

slug.description: Slug of the reference in the URL

version.description: A key-value dictionary mapping of version ID to version details

published.description: True if it can be viewed by readers

slug.description: Slug of the version in the URL

X-RateLimit-Reset.description: Unix timestamp at which requests consumed will reset

Api-Key.description: Generate an API Key from [DeveloperHub.io platform](https://app.developerhub.io) and provide it in the header such as `--header "X-Api-Key: <api-key>"` for cURL for all the requests requiring this authentication.
Api-Key.name: X-Api-Key
